XServices

There are different services / microservices that can be applied for various users and groups. The service details like the version and description will be stored for further use.

Adding new services

To add new service that you would need for different users of your project ,

  1. Select the XServices entity. The xservices list window is displayed.
  2. Select Add. The Add xservices window is displayed.
  3. Enter Name, Version and Description for the specific service. These fields are mandatory.
  4. Click Save. The new Service is now added to your project.

Deleting services

If any service is to be removed, you can delete it from the list using the Delete function.

To delete a Service:

  1. Under XServices list, click to select the service to be deleted.
  2. Click Delete. The selected service is deleted.

    Note:

    • In case you do not select a service, an error message is displayed stating “XService not selected”.

Editing services

You can edit the details for a specific service like the name, version, description as well as the related policies, resources and visibilities.

  1. Resources: To assign resources, under XServices > Edit, select Resources.
    1. From the list of available resources select a resource and click Add. Enter all details.
    2. Click Save.
  2. Policies: There are various policies defined for different services which in turn would then be applicable to the users, user groups and user’s roles. Certain rights and rules will be assigned to the user based on the policy applied.
    1. To assign a Policy, under XService > Edit, select Policies. A list of available policies is provided.
    2. Select the applicable policy and click Add.
    3. Click Save. The policies selected are then assigned to the service.
  3. Visibilities: The Visibilities entity is used to define the different entities, functions and modules that would be visible to the specific service.
    1. To assign a visibility, under XService> Edit, select Visibilities.
    2. Click Add. Enter the details for Name and Description.
    3. Click Save.

Refresh

For all entities you will be able to Refresh that page to reflect the latest data and functions applicable for the entity.
